techmeme.title: Trump claims he and Xi Jinping approved a deal for TikTok's US operations; Chinese media's readout only says that China respects the wishes of businesses (Ben Berkowitz/Axios)
Meta files an application for authorization "to sell energy, capacity, and certain ancillary services" in the US amid rising energy demand for AI datacenters (Bloomberg)
Report: OpenAI has considered building glasses, a digital voice recorder, and a pin, and has signed a deal with Luxshare to assemble at least one of its devices (Marcus Mendes/9to5Mac)
Sources: OpenAI plans to spend ~$100B on backup servers rented from cloud providers through 2030, in addition to the $350B already projected for server rentals (Sri Muppidi/The Information)
Sources: OpenAI is recruiting from Apple's hardware, design, manufacturing, and supply chain teams, as it targets late 2026 or early 2027 for its first devices (The Information)
